requirement_designation: Science, Nature and Technology with Lab
class_notes: Students, please note 2-3pm will be pre-lab activities and 3-5:20pm will be lab activities.  These will likely occur in two different rooms.
course_description: IN CHEM 203L students will be exposed to the practical aspects of working with small molecules, both organic and inorganic. Students will learn to analyze and synthesize compounds and analyze their characteristic properties such as structure, function, size distribution, and purity.
prerequisites: (CHEM 202L or CHEM_OX 202L or CHEM 202ZL) as prerequisite or co-requisite, and (CHEM 203 or CHEM_OX 203) as co-requisite, or equivalent transfer credit.
schedule_location:
MW 2pm-3pm in Atwood Chemistry Bldg. 260
MW 3pm-5:20pm in Atwood Chemistry Bldg. 248
